meanings.definition: Blocked up with or too full of something, in particular.
meanings.sent1: The congested highway was filled with cars bumper to bumper.
meanings.sent2: The doctor said my nose was congested because of a cold.
meanings.sent3: The congested parking lot resembled a can of sardines.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt congested with worries and fears.
meanings.sent5: The congested drain caused water to overflow onto the street.

meanings.definition: (of a road or place) so crowded with traffic or people as to hinder or prevent freedom of movement.
meanings.sent1: The congested city streets made it hard to get anywhere quickly.
meanings.sent2: The subway during rush hour was always congested with commuters.
meanings.sent3: The congested bus stop felt like a sardine can waiting to burst.
meanings.sent4: Her schedule was so congested with appointments that she had no time to relax.
meanings.sent5: The congested airport terminal was a sea of people rushing to their gates.
